alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Montgomery; Webster (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 24 at 9:17PM CDT until March 24 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Eastern Carroll County in north central Mississippi... Webster County in north central Mississippi... Montgomery County in north central Mississippi... * Until 1015 PM CDT. * At 917 PM CDT, a confirmed large and extremely dangerous tornado was located over Black Hawk, moving northeast at 55 mph. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. * The tornado will be near... Vaiden around 930 PM CDT. Winona around 935 PM CDT. Kilmichael around 945 PM CDT. Lodi and Sweatman around 950 PM CDT. Embry around 1000 PM CDT. Eupora and Bellefontaine around 1005 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Walthall. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a large, extremely dangerous and potentially deadly tornado is on the ground. To protect your life, TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
